skills.label: Determine the level to which a learning activity meets the rubric for collaboration
items: Prepare activities that enable students to work together, have a shared responsibility for deliverables, make decisions that are substantive and crucial to learning activity success, and work interdependently

skills.label: Analyze, evaluate, design, and manage the learning environment to facilitate student collaboration, given a set of resources available in a classroom
Modify a learning activity to meet the rubric for the highest level of skilled communication
items: Prepare activities that enable students to create product deliverables that convey a set of connected ideas, are multimodal, require supporting evidence, and are designed for a specific audience

skills.label: Evaluate student product examples to determine the level to which they meet the skilled communication rubric
items: Evaluate student product examples on the use of connected ideas, multimodal approach, supporting evidence, and design for a specific audience

skills.label: Determine the level to which a learning activity meets the knowledge construction rubric
items: Prepare interdisciplinary activities that enable students to apply knowledge in a new context

skills.label: Transform a didactic learning situation into an activity that requires students to apply knowledge in a new context that facilitates interdisciplinary learning
items: Prepare activities that enable students to spend their time and effort developing knowledge that is new to them and participate in interdisciplinary learning activities

skills.label: Determine the level to which a learning activity meets the rubric for self-regulation
items: Prepare long-term activities that enable students to plan their own work and revise work based on feedback

skills.label: Determine which opportunities facilitate an environment of self-regulation
items: Provide students with opportunities to set their learning goals, decide on the best strategies to achieve these goals, and monitor to see if these strategies are working

label: Facilitate Real World Problem Solving and Innovation

skills.label: Determine the level to which a learning activity meets the rubric for real world problem solving
items: Prepare activities that enable students to develop a solution to a problem that is new to them, complete a task that they have not been instructed how to do, or design a complex product that meets a set of requirements

skills.label: Select a strategy to encourage students to problem-solve, innovate, and apply a solution that benefits others in the real world
items: Develop learning objectives that involve real-world issues

label: Facilitate Student use of Information and Communication Tools (ICT)

skills.label: Determine the level to which a learning activity meets the rubric for use of ICT learning
items: Prepare activities that enable studentsâ€™ use of ict to support knowledge construction
Address the needs of diverse learners

skills.label: Fulfill student learning outcomes by using Microsoft technology tools
items: Identify the skills required to implement the resources

skills.label: Select the best ICT resource to help resolve or manage the logistical challenges of reaching the desired educational outcome

label: Use ICT to be an Effective Educator

skills.label: Determine which ICT resource supports a specified educational outcome
items: Rate the appropriateness of specific ict resources
Address the diverse needs of all learners

skills.label: Determine the appropriate pedagogical approach to meet an educational outcome using ICT resources
Select an appropriate ICT resource to reach a professional development goal
Evaluate responses to a scenario involving Digital Citizenship
